private_information: My peg initially holds disks from top to bottom: A, B, C, D, E, F (A smallest, F largest).
I can only move the top disk from my peg to another peg, subject to legality rules.
left_keeper.goal: Provide accurate local state and movement constraints for the left peg to enable solving the Tower of Hanoi puzzle (all disks moved to right peg).

private_information: I can only move the top disk from my peg to another peg, subject to legality rules.
middle_keeper.goal: Provide accurate local state and movement constraints for the middle peg to enable solving the Tower of Hanoi puzzle (all disks moved to right peg).

private_information: I can only move the top disk from my peg to another peg, subject to legality rules.
right_keeper.goal: Provide accurate local state and movement constraints for the right peg to enable solving the Tower of Hanoi puzzle (all disks moved to right peg).

orchestrator.goal: Integrate local peg descriptions and produce a complete PDDL domain and problem (suitable for the FastDownward solver) that solves the Tower of Hanoi instance: move all disks A..F from left to right following the rules.

public_information: There are three pegs: left, middle, and right.
Disks are labeled A (smallest) through F (largest).
Only one disk can be moved at a time.
A larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Initial configuration: left peg has (top→bottom) A, B, C, D, E, F; middle and right are empty.
Goal configuration: right peg has (top→bottom) A, B, C, D, E, F; left and middle are empty.

local_state.system_prompt: You are an agent responsible for the left peg. Do not emit PDDL. Provide a concise, machine-readable description of your peg's current stack and the identity of the top disk (if any). Provide any local movement constraints you observe.

You are an agent responsible for the middle peg. Do not emit PDDL. Provide a concise, machine-readable description of your peg's current stack and the identity of the top disk (if any). Provide any local movement constraints you observe.

You are an agent responsible for the right peg. Do not emit PDDL. Provide a concise, machine-readable description of your peg's current stack and the identity of the top disk (if any). Provide any local movement constraints you observe.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in PDDL modeling and in preparing problems for the FastDownward planner. Produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that exactly models the Tower of Hanoi constraints for this instance (6 disks, pegs left/middle/right). The domain must include object types, predicates, and actions (move) that enforce: moving one disk at a time, only the top disk can be moved, and no larger disk may be placed on a smaller disk. The problem must encode the initial and goal configurations derived from the agents' local models. You must produce output suitable for FastDownward. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
